name: abnormal contour of calvarium
description: An irregular shape or outline of the calvarium, the dome-like superior portion of the skull.

name: abnormal fibula
description: Any irregularity in the appearance, shape, or size of the fibula bone.

name: abnormal odontoid process
description: Deviations from the normal structure of the odontoid process, a bony projection of the second cervical vertebra.

name: abnormal proximal femur
description: Any deviation from the normal anatomy or pathology of the proximal femur.

name: abnormal scapula
description: Structural anomalies or variations in the scapula bone.

name: abnormal sternoclavicular joint
description: Any irregularity or abnormality of the sternoclavicular joint.

name: abnormal sternomanubrial synchondrosis
description: An anomaly or irregularity at the junction between the sternum body and manubrium.

name: abnormal sternum
description: Any deviation from the normal appearance of the sternum, the central part of the chest wall.

name: absent bow-tie sign in knee meniscus
description: The lack of the characteristic 'bow-tie' appearance of the normal menisci on certain MRI slices, suggestive of a tear.

name: absent clavicle
description: Non-visualization of the clavicle bone, either due to congenital absence or surgical removal.

name: absent digit
description: Non-existence or removal of one or more fingers or toes.

name: absent fibula
description: Total absence of the fibula bone, usually from congenital reasons.

name: absent or minimally ossified vertebrae
description: Vertebrae that are either absent or have insufficient ossification, detectable in younger patients.

name: absent thumb
description: Non-presence of the thumb, often congenital or due to surgical intervention.

name: absent tibia
description: Complete lack of the tibia bone, usually due to congenital conditions.

name: absent vertebral pedicle
description: Lack of a vertebral pedicle, typically due to agenesis or destruction.

name: accessory carpal or tarsal bones
description: Presence of extra bones in the carpal or tarsal region.

name: accessory epiphyses
description: Anomalous presence of extra epiphyses at the ends of long bones.

name: acquired absence of phalanx, digit, hand, or foot
description: Loss of any of the phalanges, digits, hand, or foot typically due to injury or surgery.

name: acquired acro-osteolysis of one digit
description: Loss of bone tissue at the distal phalanx of a digit due to various conditions.

name: acquired craniovertebral junction abnormality
description: A structural change at the junction between the cranium and cervical spine.

name: acquired fused vertebrae
description: Fusion of vertebrae that occurs after birth.

name: acquired posterior neural arch defect
description: Defect in the posterior part of the neural arch occurring after birth.

name: acquired short hands and feet
description: Shortening of bones in hands and feet not present at birth.

name: acquired skull defect
description: A defect in the skull that develops after birth.

name: acro-osteolysis
description: Resorption of the distal phalanges in the hands and/or feet.

name: acro-osteosclerosis
description: Increased bone density in the distal phalanges.

name: acromelic dwarfism
description: Disproportionally short limbs compared to trunk in dwarfism.

name: advanced bone age
description: Bone maturation more advanced than chronological age.

name: advanced bone age in a newborn
description: Newborn's bone age is older than expected for age.

name: anisospondyly
description: Unequal size or shape of vertebrae.

name: anodontia or hypodontia
description: Partial or complete absence of teeth.

name: anterior beaked vertebrae in a child
description: Protrusion at the anterior aspect of vertebrae in children.

name: anterior beaked vertebral body
description: Anterior wedge-shaped projection of vertebral body.

name: anterior vertebral scalloping
description: Indentation of the anterior vertebral body surface.

name: apophyseal lytic lesion
description: Destructive bone lesion at an apophysis.

name: arachnodactyly
description: Long, thin fingers and toes, often associated with syndromes.

name: arthritis
description: Inflammation of one or more joints.

name: arthritis with new bone formation
description: Joint inflammation with additional bone growth.

name: arthritis with osteoporosis
description: Joint inflammation in conjunction with reduced bone density.

name: arthritis with soft-tissue nodules
description: Joint inflammation with associated soft-tissue nodules.

name: arthritis with subluxation
description: Joint inflammation accompanied by partial dislocation.

name: arthritis with swan-neck deformity
description: Joint inflammation with finger deformity characterized by hyperextension of the PIP joint.

name: arthritis without osteoporosis
description: Joint inflammation occurring in the absence of osteoporosis.

name: arthropathy
description: Diseases affecting the joints.

name: asymmetrical sacroiliac joint abnormality
description: Uneven changes or differences in the sacroiliac joints.

name: asymmetrical sacroiliac joint disease
description: Disorder affecting one sacroiliac joint more than the other.

name: asymmetrically large bones of one hand
description: Bones in one hand are larger than usual on one side.

name: asymmetrically small bones of one hand
description: Bones in one hand are smaller than usual on one side.

name: atlantoaxial instability
description: Excessive movement between the first and second cervical vertebrae.

name: avascular necrosis
description: Death of bone tissue due to lack of blood supply.

name: Baker cyst
description: Fluid-filled cyst behind the knee.

name: band-like erosion of the midportion of a terminal phalanx
description: Erosive changes appearing as a band across a terminal phalanx.

name: basilar invagination
description: Upward displacement of vertebral elements into the skull base.

name: battered child syndrome
description: Multiple injuries in different stages of healing suggestive of abuse.

name: beaded rib
description: Ribs with bead-like protrusions on the surface.

name: benign bone neoplasm
description: Non-cancerous bone tumor.

name: benign fibrocystic bone lesion
description: Fibrous and cystic non-cancerous bone lesion.

name: benign synovial lesion
description: Non-cancerous tumor-like growth in synovial tissue.

name: biconcave vertebra
description: Vertebra with collapsed central endplate leading to biconcave shape.

name: biparietal bossing
description: Prominent or protruding bilateral parietal bones of the skull.

name: blow-out bone lesion
description: A cystic bone lesion that expands and blows out the cortex, often having a thin rim of bone left.

name: body asymmetry
description: Unequal size or shape on different sides of the body.

name: bone blister
description: Thin-walled cystic lesion of cortical bone, appearing like a blister.

name: bone duplication
description: Appearance of extra bone structures resembling duplication.

name: bone infarct
description: Death of bone tissue due to lack of blood supply, appearing as sclerosis.

name: bone lesion with fluid-fluid level
description: A lesion in bone with distinct fluid-fluid levels, often in aneurysmal bone cysts.

name: bone medullary space stenosis
description: Narrowing of the medullary space within bones.

name: bone sequestrum
description: Fragment of dead bone separated from living bone in osteomyelitis.

name: bone tumor with periosteal reaction
description: Bone tumor that induces a response in the periosteum, often seen as periosteal elevation or new bone formation.

name: bone-in-bone vertebra
description: Appearance of vertebral bodies resembling one bone inside another, often seen in growth disorders.

name: bone-within-a-bone appearance
description: Radiological sign where bone appears encapsulated within another bone.

name: bony whiskering
description: Fine, radiating lines of bone at a periosteum, resembling whiskers.

name: bowed bones
description: Exaggerated curve in long bones.

name: bowed femur
description: Curvature of the femur bone.

name: bowed tubular bones
description: Bowing of the shaft of tubular bones such as tibia, fibula.

name: brachydactyly
description: Shortness of the fingers or toes due to underdeveloped phalanges.

name: bridging of the pubic symphysis
description: Abnormal bone formation across the pubic symphysis.

name: broad distal phalanges
description: Widening of the distal phalangeal bones.

name: broad distal phalanx of thumb
description: Widening of the distal phalanx of the thumb specifically.

name: broad middle phalanges
description: Widened phalanges of the fingers, usually a congenital anomaly.

name: broad thumb
description: Unusually wide thumb, often associated with genetic syndromes.

name: broad toe
description: Unusually wide toes, frequently seen in congenital syndromes.

name: broad tubular bones
description: Widened long bones characterized by increased thickness, indicating a congenital or systemic process.

name: bursal calcification
description: Calcium deposits in the bursa, often from chronic inflammation or trauma.

name: button sequestrum of skull
description: A small, round area of necrotic bone within the skull, often seen in osteomyelitis.

name: calcaneal bone resorption
description: Loss of bone density in the calcaneus, often indicative of metabolic or systemic processes.

name: calcification about the fingertips
description: Calcium deposits near the fingertips, often associated with connective tissue disorders.

name: calcification in a ligament
description: Calcium deposition within a ligament, typically seen in chronic injury.

name: calcification in a tendon
description: Calcium deposition within a tendon, often due to chronic tendinopathy.

name: calcification in lymph nodes
description: Presence of calcium in lymph nodes, commonly seen in granulomatous diseases.

name: calcified intra-articular body
description: A calcified fragment within a joint space, indicative of degenerative changes.

name: calvarial hyperostosis
description: Thickening of the skull bones, potentially due to metabolic or inflammatory processes.

name: camptodactyly
description: Permanent flexion of one or more fingers, often a congenital trait.

name: carpal and/or tarsal fusion
description: Fusion of carpal or tarsal bones often due to congenital disorders.

name: carpal fusion
description: Fusion of carpal bones, typically indicating a congenital or inflammatory condition.

name: cervical kyphosis
description: Abnormal curvature of the cervical spine, often from degenerative changes or congenital conditions.

name: cervical spine fusion
description: Fusion of cervical vertebrae, which could be congenital or surgical.

name: chondral calcification
description: Calcium deposition in cartilage, often associated with aging or degenerative joint diseases.

name: chondrocalcinosis
description: Calcium pyrophosphate dihydrate deposition disease affecting joints.

name: chondromatosis
description: A non-cancerous condition in which cartilage grows abnormally within the synovium or tendon sheath.

name: chondrosarcoma
description: A type of cancer that forms in cartilage cells.

name: chronic lateral ankle pain
description: Persistent pain located on the outside of the ankle.

name: clavicle dysplasia
description: Abnormal development of the clavicle bones.

name: clavicle hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment or incomplete development of the clavicle.

name: clavicular lesion in an infant or child
description: Any abnormal tissue or growth identified in the clavicle of a child.

name: cleft lip/palate
description: A congenital split in the upper lip and/or roof of the mouth.

name: clinodactyly
description: Curvature of a finger in the plane of the palm.

name: clinodactyly of fifth finger
description: Curvature of the little finger towards the other fingers.

name: cloverleaf skull deformity
description: A cranial deformity typically associated with severe craniosynostosis.

name: clubbing of digits
description: Enlargement of the ends of fingers and toes due to proliferation of connective tissue.

name: clubfoot
description: A birth defect in which the foot is twisted out of shape or position.

name: cone-shaped epiphysis
description: A cone-like appearance of the epiphysis, often associated with genetic conditions.

name: congenital abnormality of great toe
description: An unusual or malformed condition present at birth affecting the great toe.

name: congenital absence of phalanx, digit, hand, or foot
description: A condition where part or all of a phalanx or entire digit, hand or foot is missing from birth.

name: congenital atlantoaxial subluxation or instability
description: A condition often seen in Down syndrome where the joint between the first and second cervical vertebrae is unstable.

name: congenital coxa vara
description: A deformity of the hip where the angle between the head and the shaft of the femur is reduced.

name: congenital craniovertebral junction abnormality
description: Anomalies at the junction of the skull and spine that are present from birth.

name: congenital elbow anomaly
description: Birth defects affecting the elbow joint.

name: congenital foot deformity
description: Any deformity of the foot present at birth.

name: congenital fused vertebrae
description: Fusion of two or more vertebrae present at birth.

name: congenital generalized osteoporosis
description: Diffuse low bone density present from birth.

name: congenital joint subluxation
description: Incomplete or partial dislocation of a joint present at birth.

name: congenital macrocephaly
description: Abnormally large head size present from birth.

name: congenital narrow spinal canal
description: Reduced diameter of the spinal canal present from birth.

name: congenital posterior neural arch defect
description: Defect in the posterior elements of the neural arch present from birth.

name: congenital premature craniosynostosis
description: Early fusion of cranial sutures present at birth.

name: congenital short hands and feet
description: Abnormally short hands and feet present from birth.

name: congenital short limbs
description: Abnormally short limbs present from birth.

name: congenital vertebral abnormality
description: Any vertebral anomaly present from birth.

name: congenital widespread osteosclerosis
description: Increased bone density present from birth.

name: congenitally abnormal pelvis
description: Anomalous pelvic shape or structure present from birth.

name: congenitally abnormal scapula
description: Malformation of the scapula present from birth.

name: congenitally limited joint mobility
description: Restricted joint movement present from birth.

name: contracted hand
description: Deformity causing the fingers to bend towards the palm.

name: contracture of a digit
description: Fixed bending of a finger or toe.

name: coronal cleft vertebrae
description: Cleft in the coronal plane of a vertebra.

name: cortical bone thickening
description: Increased thickness of the cortical bone.

name: coxa valga
description: Increased angle between the femoral neck and shaft.

name: coxa vara
description: Decreased angle between the femoral neck and shaft.

name: craniosynostosis
description: Premature fusion of one or more cranial sutures, leading to skull deformity.

name: craniotubular dysplasia
description: A group of rare genetic disorders affecting bone growth resulting in cranial and tubular bone deformities.

name: CSF-intensity intramedullary lesion
description: Lesion within the spinal cord with similar signal intensity to cerebrospinal fluid on MRI.

name: cuboid vertebrae
description: Vertebrae with a square-shaped appearance, often associated with congenital disorders.

name: cutis laxa
description: A connective tissue disorder characterized by loose, sagging skin and sometimes internal organ involvement.

name: cystic soft-tissue tumor
description: Tumor with a fluid-filled cystic component in soft tissues.

name: dactylitis
description: Swelling of the fingers or toes often due to inflammation.

name: decreased carpal angle
description: Reduction in the angle between specific carpal bones, often indicative of pathology.

name: decreased cranial convolutional markings
description: Reduced visibility of the brain's gyri and sulci, usually signifying brain atrophy.

name: decreased muscle mass
description: Reduction in the normal bulk of muscle tissue, often seen in various systemic conditions.

name: decreased number of ribs
description: Congenital absence or reduction in the number of ribs.

name: decreased subcutaneous fat
description: Reduced thickness of fat beneath the skin, potentially indicating systemic conditions.

name: defect in distal sternum
description: Abnormality or deficit in the lower segment of the sternum.

name: defective cranial ossification
description: Insufficient or abnormal bone formation in the skull.

name: defective pubic ossification
description: Insufficient or abnormal bone formation in the pubic region.

name: degenerative joint changes
description: Alterations in joint structure due to chronic wear or arthritis; common with aging.

name: delayed bone age
description: Bone maturation lagging behind chronological age typically assessed via hand or wrist X-ray.

name: delayed closure of fontanelles
description: Postponed closing of the gaps between cranial bones in infants.

name: delayed ossification of the pubic bone
description: Lag in the ossification process of the pubic bone.

name: delta phalanx
description: An angular deformity of a phalanx resulting in a delta shape, associated with congenital hand abnormalities.

name: dense epiphyses of hands and feet
description: Increased density in the epiphyseal regions of hands and feet.

name: dense or thick skull
description: Increased thickness or density of the skull bones.

name: dense subchondral zone of vertebra
description: Increased density in the subchondral region of a vertebra.

name: dense temporal bone lesion
description: Increased density within the temporal bone, possibly indicating a pathological process.

name: dense vertical metaphyseal lines
description: Vertical dense lines in the metaphyseal region, associated with growth arrest or metabolic conditions.

name: densely sclerotic vertebra
description: Increased sclerosis or density of a vertebral body.

name: dental cyst
description: Cystic lesion associated with a tooth, often odontogenic in origin.

name: dental defect
description: Defect in the structure of a tooth, which may be due to caries or developmental issues.

name: destructive lesion in petrous apex
description: A lesion causing bone destruction in the petrous portion of the temporal bone.

name: diametaphyseal bone lesion
description: Lesion located at the diametaphyseal junction of a bone.

name: diaphyseal bone lesion
description: Lesion located in the diaphysis, or shaft, of a long bone.

name: diffuse demineralization of skull
description: Generalized loss of bone density in the skull.

name: diffusely dense calvarium
description: Increased density of the calvarial bones.

name: diffusely dense skull base
description: Increased density of the bones forming the base of the skull.

name: diffusely small cord
description: Shrinkage or atrophy of the spinal cord.

name: disk calcification
description: Calcification within an intervertebral disk.

name: displaced elbow fat pad
description: Displacement or elevation of fat pads around the elbow joint, often indicative of joint effusion or fracture.

name: disrupted epiphyseal-metaphyseal junction
description: Disruption at the epiphyseal-metaphyseal junction, often considers fracture or growth plate injury.

name: distal clavicle defect
description: Defect or irregularity noted in the distal clavicle.

name: distal tapering of short tubular bones of the hands and feet
description: Narrowing or tapering at the distal ends of short tubular bones, often seen in dysplasias.

name: drumstick distal phalanges
description: Enlargement of the distal phalanges of fingers resembling a drumstick.

name: dumbbell bones
description: Bones that have a characteristic 'dumbbell' appearance.

name: dumbbell-shaped tubular bones
description: Tubular bones with a 'dumbbell' shape appearance due to bony deformity.

name: duplication of great toe
description: The presence of an additional great toe, a form of polydactyly.

name: dysostosis multiplex
description: A group of skeletal abnormalities typically seen in mucopolysaccharidoses.

name: dysplastic sella turcica
description: Abnormal development of the sella turcica.

name: dysplastic vertebral pedicle
description: Abnormal formation or growth of a vertebral pedicle.

name: early femoral head ossification
description: Premature ossification of the femoral head.

name: ectopic thumb
description: Abnormal position or displacement of the thumb.

name: ectrodactyly
description: Split hand/foot malformation also known as 'lobster claw deformity'.

name: elbow dislocation
description: Displacement of the bones in the elbow joint.

name: eleven pairs of ribs
description: One fewer than the normal twelve pairs of ribs.

name: elongated clavicle
description: Clavicle that is longer than normal.

name: elongated sella turcica
description: Sella turcica that appears longer than normal.

name: enhancing spinal cord lesion
description: A lesion in the spinal cord that enhances after contrast administration.

name: enlarged distal femoral intercondylar notch
description: The distal femoral intercondylar notch is larger than normal.

name: enlarged foramen magnum
description: Foramen magnum appears larger than normal, suggesting conditions such as Chiari malformation.

name: enlarged intervertebral foramen
description: An increase in the size of the intervertebral foramina.

name: enlarged medial femoral condyle
description: The medial femoral condyle is bigger than normal, can be evaluated for osteochondral abnormalities

name: enlarged nerve roots
description: Nerve roots appear larger than normal, indicative of conditions like schwannoma or neurofibromatosis.

name: enlarged orbital rectus muscles
description: Thickening of the extraocular muscles in the orbit.

name: enlarged thumb
description: An abnormally large thumb due to various causes.

name: enlarged vertebrae
description: Abnormal enlargement of one or more vertebrae.

name: enlarged vertebral pedicle
description: Enlargement of the vertebral pedicle, potentially indicating a pathological process.

name: enlargement or erosion of sella turcica
description: Changes in the size or integrity of the sella turcica, often due to pituitary abnormalities.

name: enthesopathy
description: Disorder of the tendon or ligament attachment to bone.

name: epiphyseal lytic lesion
description: Bone lesion located in the epiphyseal region, characterized by bone lysis.

name: epiphyseal necrosis
description: Death of bone tissue in the epiphysis.

name: Erlenmeyer flask deformity
description: Flared metaphysis of the bone resembling an Erlenmeyer flask.

name: erosion of cortical bone surface
description: Loss of bone normally on the cortex, often due to inflammatory or neoplastic processes.

name: erosion of inner table of skull
description: Loss of bone on the inner aspect of the skull, indicating a pathological process.

name: erosion of mastoid
description: Destruction of the mastoid part of the temporal bone.

name: erosion of sphenoid wing
description: Loss of bone making up the sphenoidal wing.

name: erosion of the petrous ridge, pyramid, or apex
description: Bone loss in regions of the temporal bone including petrous ridge, pyramid, or apex.

name: erosion of tympanic portion of petrous bone
description: Bone loss in the tympanic portion of the temporal bone.

name: erosion or widening of the internal auditory meatus
description: Destruction or enlargement of the canal carrying the vestibulocochlear nerve.

name: excess callus formation
description: Excessive bone formation at a fracture site during healing.

name: exostosis
description: Benign bone growth usually protruding from bone surface.

name: expansile bone lesion
description: Lesion causing bone expansion, often associated with cortical thinning.

name: extradural lesion with abnormal adjacent bone
description: Lesion located outside the dura mater affecting nearby bone.

name: extradural lesion with normal adjacent bone
description: Lesion located outside the dura mater with surrounding bones appearing normal.

name: extradural spinal lesion
description: Abnormal lesion located outside the dura mater in the spinal region.

name: extramedullary intradural signal void
description: An abnormal area within the dura mater but outside the medullary canal showing no signal.

name: facial asymmetry
description: Uneven proportions or appearance of the two sides of the face.

name: facial hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment or incomplete development of facial structures.

name: femoral head dysplasia
description: Abnormal development or growth of the femoral head.

name: fibrous tumor
description: Tumor composed mainly of fibrous or fibrous-like tissue.

name: fingertip calcification
description: Calcium deposits located at the fingertips.

name: flaring of ribs
description: Outward expansion or spreading of the ribs.

name: flat femoral head
description: Lack of a normal spherical contour of the femoral head.

name: flat occiput
description: Loss of normal convexity at the back of the skull.

name: flattened vertebral pedicle
description: Reduced or compressed height of the vertebral pedicle.

name: floating teeth
description: Teeth appear dislocated from the alveolar process on imaging.

name: focal vertebral sclerosis
description: Increased bone density in a localized area of a vertebra.

name: focally dense calvarium
description: Localized area of increased density in the calvarium.

name: focally dense skull base
description: Localized area of increased density at the base of the skull.

name: focally small spinal cord
description: Localized segment of spinal cord appearing smaller than normal.

name: forearm deformity
description: Abnormal shape or structure of the forearm.

name: fragmented femoral head
description: Presence of incomplete and separated bony elements in the femoral head.

name: fragmented or irregular femoral head
description: Femoral head appearing irregular or split into multiple segments.

name: fragmented, irregular, or sclerotic carpal or tarsal bones
description: Abnormal appearance of carpal or tarsal bones, indicating possible pathology.

name: frontal bossing
description: Prominent forehead due to protrusion of the frontal bone.

name: gangrene of finger or toe
description: Tissue death, typically due to loss of blood supply, affecting fingers or toes.

name: gas within bone
description: Presence of gas seen in the bone, typically indicating infection or trauma.

name: generalized asymmetry of hand bones
description: Uneven or mismatched growth or size of hand bones.

name: generalized large epiphyses
description: Enlarged epiphysis at multiple sites, possibly linked to specific growth conditions.

name: generalized osteoporosis
description: Reduction in bone density throughout the skeleton, leading to fragile bones.

name: generalized skull thinning
description: Diffuse thinning of the skull bones, possibly indicating a systemic condition.

name: generalized small epiphyses
description: Reduced size of epiphyses at multiple skeletal sites.

name: generalized wide epiphyseal plate
description: Increased width of epiphyseal plates in multiple bones, often seen in growth disorders.

name: genu valgum
description: Condition where knees angle in and touch each other when the legs are straightened.

name: genu varum
description: Condition where knees remain apart when the legs are straightened, resembling a bow-legged appearance.

name: gigantism
description: Abnormal overgrowth often due to excess growth hormone, primarily evident in bones.

name: gout
description: Form of inflammatory arthritis characterized by recurrent attacks of a red, tender, hot, and swollen joint.

name: hair-on-end pattern in skull
description: Radiological appearance resembling hair standing on end, often seen in hemolytic anemias.

name: hair-on-end skull
description: Describes the hair-on-end appearance of the skull on radiographs.

name: hand contracture
description: Condition where the fingers are permanently bent into a flexed position.

name: hemiatrophy
description: Condition characterized by the wasting away of one side of the body or a body part.

name: hemihypertrophy
description: Abnormal overgrowth of one side of the body or part of it.

name: hip dislocation
description: Displacement of the femoral head from its position in the hip socket.

name: hip subluxation
description: Partial dislocation of the hip joint where the femoral head is not completely seated in the acetabulum.

name: hooked clavicle
description: Abnormal curvature or hook-like appearance of the clavicle.

name: humeral head deformity
description: Abnormal shape or structure of the proximal humerus.

name: humerus-radius-ulna synostosis
description: Fusion of the humerus, radius, and ulna bones.

name: hyperphalangism
description: Presence of extra phalangeal bones in the fingers or toes.

name: hypertrophic osteoarthropathy
description: Syndrome characterized by digital clubbing, periostitis, and arthritis.

name: hypoplastic fibula
description: Underdevelopment or incomplete formation of the fibula bone.

name: hypoplastic pelvis
description: Underdeveloped or incompletely formed pelvic bones.

name: hypoplastic terminal phalanges
description: Underdevelopment of the distal bones of the fingers or toes.

name: hypoplastic thumb
description: Underdevelopment of the thumb.

name: hypoplastic vertebral pedicle
description: Underdevelopment of the vertebral pedicle, potentially leading to instability or scoliosis.

name: incomplete ossification of cranial sutures
description: Failure of cranial sutures to fully ossify, potentially indicating a developmental delay or anomaly.

name: increased bone age
description: Advanced bone maturation compared to chronological age.

name: increased carpal angle
description: Abnormally large angle between the radius and the carpal bones.

name: increased cranial convolutional markings
description: Prominent impressions of cerebral gyri on the inner table of the skull, often seen in pediatric patients.

name: increased muscle mass
description: Larger than normal muscle size, which may be due to hypertrophy or other conditions.

name: increased soft-tissue interstitial markings
description: Diffuse increase in radiodensity of soft tissue structures, potentially indicating edema or inflammation.

name: increased subcutaneous fat
description: Excess fat beneath the skin surface, may be diffuse or localized.

name: indistinct epiphyses
description: Poorly defined borders of the epiphyseal growth plates, commonly in developmental disorders.

name: indistinct frayed metaphyses
description: Irregular and unclear metaphyseal margins, often seen in conditions with disrupted bone growth.

name: infrapatellar mass in Hoffa fat pad
description: A mass located in the Hoffa fat pad region beneath the patella.

name: intermediate T1 intensity diffuse vertebral body abnormality
description: Diffuse change in vertebral body showing intermediate T1 signal intensity.

name: intermuscular soft-tissue tumor
description: A soft-tissue mass located between muscles.

name: intervertebral disk calcification
description: Calcification within intervertebral disks.

name: intra-articular calcification
description: Calcification occurring within a joint space.

name: intra-articular or juxta-articular soft-tissue tumor
description: Tumor located within or adjacent to a joint.

name: intradural extramedullary spinal lesion
description: A lesion located between the dura mater and the spinal cord.

name: intramedullary spinal lesion
description: Lesion within the spinal cord itself.

name: intramuscular soft-tissue tumor
description: A mass located within muscle tissue.

name: irregular epiphyseal ossification centers
description: Abnormal, uneven ossification in the growth plates of bones.

name: irregular epiphysis
description: An irregular shape of the end portion of a long bone.

name: irregular foramen magnum
description: Abnormal shape or irregularity of the foramen magnum.

name: isolated tibial bowing
description: Anterior or lateral curvature of the tibia.

name: J-shaped sella turcica
description: Abnormal shape of sella turcica likened to a 'J'.

name: joint effusion
description: Excess fluid accumulation in or around a joint.

name: joint laxity
description: Abnormal looseness of a joint.

name: joint subluxation
description: Partial dislocation of a joint.

name: joint-crossing bone lesion
description: Bone lesion that spans across a joint.

name: juxta-articular soft-tissue mass
description: A tumor located next to a joint.

name: large anterior canal of a vertebral body
description: An unusually large anterior canal seen in vertebrae.

name: large destructive bone lesion
description: A large area of bone destruction likely indicating aggressive pathology

name: large epiphysis
description: An unusually large growth plate or bone end, often seen in certain syndromes or endocrine disorders

name: large fontanelle
description: An enlarged soft spot on an infant's head, possibly indicating developmental or intracranial conditions

name: large foramen magnum
description: An enlarged opening at the base of the skull which may affect neurological structures

name: large hands for age
description: Hands larger than expected for an individual's chronological age, potentially indicative of certain syndromes

name: large thumb
description: An abnormally large thumb, which may indicate a genetic or developmental disorder

name: large vascular grooves of skull
description: Prominent channels on the inner surface of the skull where blood vessels reside

name: late-onset dwarfism
description: Delayed growth resulting in short stature, diagnosed later in life

name: lethal skeletal dysplasia
description: Severe bone dysplasia resulting in perinatal lethality

name: limb asymmetry
description: Unequal size or length between two corresponding limbs

name: limb overgrowth
description: Abnormal increase in size of one or more limbs

name: limb reduction
description: Reduction in size or absence of part of a limb

name: limited joint mobility
description: Restricted range of motion in one or more joints

name: localized bone overgrowth
description: Focal increase in bone mass or size

name: localized bony defect about the optic canal
description: Specific bone defect near the optic nerve canal, potentially compressive

name: localized brachydactyly
description: Shortening of specific fingers or toes

name: localized bulge of the calvarium or scalp
description: Focal area of swelling on the skull or skin covering it

name: localized cortical bone thickening
description: Increased thickness of the outer bone layer in a specific area

name: localized large epiphyses
description: Focal enlargement of bone ends specific to limbs

name: localized periosteal reaction
description: Localized new bone formation along the periosteum, indicative of irritation or inflammation

name: localized skull thinning
description: Thinning of the skull at a specific localized region.

name: localized small epiphyses
description: Reduced size of the epiphyses in a localized area.

name: localized soft-tissue calcification
description: Calcification in soft tissue in a specific area.

name: localized sunburst pattern in skull
description: Sunburst radiating pattern in the skull, often indicative of aggressive lesions.

name: localized wide epiphyseal plate
description: Widening of epiphyseal plate in one area.

name: long rib lesion
description: Lesion extending along the length of the rib.

name: long thin bones
description: Bones are abnormally elongated and thin.

name: longitudinal metaphyseal-diaphyseal striations
description: Striations seen from metaphyseal to diaphyseal regions along the length of the bone.

name: loss of inner cortical bone margin
description: Absence of the inner margin of cortical bone on imaging.

name: lucent bone lesion with sclerotic rim
description: Radiolucent area within bone surrounded by a rim of sclerosis.

name: lucent defect in bones of hands, wrists, feet, or ankles
description: Radiolucent defects in small, distal bones.

name: lucent lesion of the calcaneus
description: Radiolucent area within the calcaneus bone.

name: lymph node filling defect
description: Defect seen within a lymph node suggesting a pathological process.

name: lymphangiectasia
description: Dilation of lymphatic vessels.

name: lytic patellar lesion
description: Lytic lesion observed in the patella bone.

name: lytic phalangeal lesion
description: Lytic lesion in one or more phalanges.

name: lytic skeletal lesion
description: Lytic lesion affecting any part of the skeleton.

name: lytic vertebral lesion
description: Lytic lesion present in a vertebral body.

name: macrodactyly
description: Abnormal enlargement of the fingers or toes.

name: Madelung deformity
description: Deformity of the wrist due to abnormal growth of radius, ulna, and carpal bones.

name: male-predominant arthritis
description: A type of arthritis that occurs more frequently in males.

name: malformed patella
description: An abnormally shaped kneecap.

name: malignant primary bone neoplasm
description: A cancerous tumor originating in the bone.

name: mandibular agenesis/dysgenesis
description: Underdevelopment or absence of the mandible.

name: marfanoid appearance
description: Features resembling Marfan syndrome, such as long extremities.

name: medial proximal metaphyseal erosion of the long bones
description: Erosion of the metaphysis near the joint on the medial side of long bones.

name: mesomelic dwarfism
description: Shortening of the middle segments of the limbs.

name: mesomelic limb shortness

name: metaphyseal bone lesion
description: Lesion within the metaphysis of a bone.

name: metaphyseal cupping
description: The metaphysis appears widened and concave.

name: metaphyseal fragmentation
description: Breaking apart of the metaphyseal region of bones.

name: metaphyseal irregularity
description: Irregular surface or structure of the metaphysis.

name: metaphyseal sclerosis
description: Increased density of the metaphyseal bone.

name: metaphyseal spur
description: A bony projection from the metaphysis.

name: metastasis to subarachnoid space
description: Cancer spread to the subarachnoid space.

name: metatarsus adductus
description: Inward deviation of the forefoot.

name: microcephaly
description: Head circumference smaller than normal for age and sex.

name: minimal vertebral ossification
description: Lack of adequate ossification in vertebrae.

name: monoarticular joint disease
description: Disease affecting a single joint.

name: multifocal soft-tissue tumor
description: Presence of multiple soft-tissue tumors.

name: multiple abnormal epiphyses
description: Abnormal development or appearance of multiple epiphyses.

name: multiple calcaneal ossification centers
description: Presence of multiple areas of bone formation in the calcaneus.

name: multiple collapsed vertebrae
description: Collapse or compression of multiple vertebrae.

name: multiple expanding rib lesions
description: Presence of progressively enlarging lesions in multiple ribs.

name: multiple fractures
description: Presence of fractures at multiple sites.

name: multiple intra-articular filling defects
description: Presence of irregularities inside joint spaces seen on imaging.

name: multiple osteosclerotic bone lesions
description: Presence of several sclerotic areas within bones.

name: multiple radiolucent bone lesions
description: Presence of several areas where bone density is lower than normal.

name: multiple sclerotic foci in an infant or child
description: Sclerotic areas within bones of a young patient.

name: muscle enlargement
description: Increase in the bulk or size of muscle tissue.

name: muscular atrophy
description: Decrease in muscle mass or wasting of muscle tissue.

name: muscular dystrophy
description: Group of genetic disorders causing muscle weakness and degeneration.

name: musculoskeletal lesion with adjacent edema
description: Lesion within the musculoskeletal system with nearby swelling.

name: myopathy
description: Disease or disorder of muscle tissue.

name: myotonic disorder
description: A condition characterized by prolonged muscle contraction and difficulty relaxing muscles.

name: narrow intervertebral disk space
description: Reduction in the normal height between vertebrae indicating disc degeneration.

name: narrow pelvis in an infant or child
description: Pelvic bone dimensions are smaller than expected in a pediatric patient.

name: narrow spinal canal
description: Reduction in space within the spinal canal.

name: narrowed joint space
description: Reduction in spacing within a joint indicating potential arthritis.

name: natal teeth
description: Teeth present at birth or within the first month of life.

name: nerve calcification
description: Calcium deposits within nerve tissue

name: nerve root enhancement
description: Increased signal intensity of a nerve root post-contrast

name: neuropathic arthropathy
description: Degenerative joint disease due to nerve dysfunction

name: neuropathic bone changes of the hands or feet
description: Bone deformities or destruction associated with neuropathy

name: non-neoplastic bone lesion
description: Bone lesions not caused by tumor growth

name: notching of the superior rib margins
description: Indentations on the upper edges of the ribs

name: odontoid aplasia
description: Absence of the odontoid process

name: odontoid hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the odontoid process

name: omega sella
description: Sellar region with an omega shape

name: orbital bony defect
description: Physical defect in the bones of the orbit

name: orbital wall sclerosis
description: Thickening and hardening of orbital walls

name: osteolysis
description: Bone loss or resorption

name: osteolytic lesion with calcium attenuation
description: Lytic bone lesion with areas of calcium density

name: osteolytic metastasis
description: Secondary bone tumor causing destruction

name: osteomalacia
description: Softening of bones due to poor mineralization

name: osteosarcoma
description: Malignant bone tumor

name: osteosclerosis
description: Increased bone density

name: oversegmentation of sternum
description: Additional division within the sternum

name: paraspinal soft-tissue mass
description: Mass adjacent to the spinal column

name: patella alta
description: Higher position of the patella than normal

name: patella baja
description: Condition where the patella is positioned lower than normal.

name: pathologic fracture
description: Fracture occurring in bone weakened by disease.

name: pectoral muscle deficiency
description: Absence or underdevelopment of pectoral muscles.

name: pectus carinatum
description: Chest wall deformity characterized by a protruding sternum.

name: pectus excavatum
description: Chest wall deformity with a sunken sternum.

name: pediatric chest wall lesion
description: Any abnormal growth or development on the chest wall in children.

name: pelvic exostosis
description: Bony protrusion occurring on the pelvic bones.

name: periarticular calcification
description: Calcification occurring around a joint.

name: periosteal cloaking
description: Thickening or elevation of the periosteum seen in images.

name: periosteal new bone formation in a child
description: New bone formation seen along the periosteum in children.

name: periosteal reaction involving the clavicle
description: New bone formation along the periosteum of the clavicle.

name: permeative osteolytic lesion
description: Bone lesion characterized by multiple small areas of bone loss.

name: plantar calcaneal spur

name: platyspondyly
description: Flattened vertebral bodies seen in imaging.

name: polyarticular joint disease
description: Disease involving multiple joints.

name: polydactyly
description: Condition where a person has more than five fingers or toes per hand or foot.

name: polyostotic bone lesions in adults
description: Multiple bone lesions detected in an adult patient.

name: polyostotic bone lesions in an infant or young child
description: Multiple bone lesions detected in an infant or young child.

name: polyostotic bone lesions in children
description: Multiple bone lesions detected in a child.

name: postaxial polydactyly

name: posterior vertebral scalloping
description: Erosion or notching of the posterior aspect of vertebral bodies

name: preaxial polydactyly
description: Presence of extra digits on the thumb side of hands or great toe side of feet

name: premature craniosynostosis
description: Early fusion of cranial sutures

name: premature epiphyseal fusion
description: Early closure of growth plates

name: premature osteoarthritis
description: Early-onset degenerative joint disease

name: presacral mass
description: Mass located anterior to the sacrum

name: prominent occiput
description: Exaggerated roundness of the occipital bone

name: proton density-hyperintense supraspinatus tendon
description: Increased proton density signal in the supraspinatus tendon

name: protrusio acetabuli
description: Medial displacement of the acetabulum into the pelvic cavity

name: proximal femoral deficiency
description: Underdevelopment of the proximal part of the femur

name: proximal tapering of short tubular bones of the hands and feet
description: Bones of hands and feet exhibit narrowing at proximal ends

name: pseudoarthrosis
description: False joint resulting from non-union of a fracture

name: pseudoepiphyses

name: pseudofracture
description: Radiolucent line mimicking a fracture, often seen in conditions like osteomalacia

name: pseudomacrodactyly
description: Apparent enlargement of a digit due to soft tissue mass

name: pterygium
description: Wing-like fold of tissue, can occur in various regions such as the eye (medical context specific to ophthalmology)

name: pubic bone nonossification
description: Lack of bone formation in the pubic region

name: punctate epiphyseal calcification
description: Small calcifications in the epiphyseal regions of bones

name: radial ray hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the radial structures of the arm

name: radial ray syndrome
description: Genetic syndrome characterized by abnormalities of the radial ray

name: radiohumeral synostosis
description: Fusion between the radius and humerus near the elbow joint.

name: radiolucent metaphyseal bands
description: Bands of decreased density in the metaphysis of long bones.

name: radiolucent skull lesion
description: An area of reduced density in the skull visible on imaging.

name: regional osteoporosis

name: resorption of distal clavicle

name: retarded skeletal maturation

name: rheumatoid-like arthritis
description: Inflammatory joint disease resembling rheumatoid arthritis.

name: rhizomelic dwarfism
description: A form of dwarfism characterized by shortening of the proximal limbs.

name: rhizomelic limb shortness
description: Shortening of the proximal segments of the limbs.

name: rib anomaly
description: Abnormal formation or development of a rib.

name: rib gap
description: A gap or discontinuity in a rib.

name: rib lesion in a child
description: An abnormal area of bone in a child's rib.

name: rib notching
description: Indents or notches seen on the underside of a rib.

name: ribbon-like ribs
description: Ribs that appear flat and wide, resembling a ribbon.

name: rickets

name: ring epiphyses
description: Epiphyseal growth plates that appear as ring-shaped on images.

name: ring-shaped epiphysis
description: An epiphyseal plate that appears ring-shaped.

name: round cell bone lesion
description: Bone lesion consisting of small, round, undifferentiated cells.

name: round vertebrae
description: Vertebrae that appear spherical or rounded on imaging.

name: round-cell soft-tissue lesion
description: A soft tissue lesion composed of small, round cells.

name: sacral agenesis or hypoplasia
description: Partial or complete absence of the sacrum

name: sacral deformity
description: Abnormal shape or form of the sacrum

name: sacral neoplasm

name: sacrococcygeal appendage
description: Anomalous projection or outgrowth at the sacrococcygeal region

name: sacrococcygeal mass
description: Presence of a mass in the sacrococcygeal area

name: sacroiliac joint disease
description: Pathological condition affecting the sacroiliac joint

name: scapular lesion in an infant or child
description: Abnormal finding on the scapula in pediatric patients

name: scattered decreased and increased bone density
description: Areas of altered bone density, both increased and decreased scattered throughout the skeleton

name: sclerosing bone dysplasia
description: Group of disorders characterized by increased bone density

description: Increased bone density associated with new bone formation along the periosteum

name: sclerosis of the orbital roof

name: sclerotic clavicle
description: Increased bone density of the clavicle

name: sclerotic epiphysis
description: Increased bone density in the epiphysis

name: sclerotic foot bone lesion
description: Increased bone density in a lesion within the foot bones

name: sclerotic hand bone lesion
description: Increased bone density in a lesion within the hand bones

description: Degenerative joint disease occurring in the hip secondary to another arthropathy or disorder

name: self-mutilation
description: Deliberate injury to one's own body tissue

description: Widening or abnormal separation of sutures in a child's skull

name: serrated iliac crest
description: Wavy or notched appearance of the iliac crest

name: serrated iliac crests
description: Wavy or notched appearance of the iliac crests

name: sesamoid lytic lesion
description: Radiolucent area in a sesamoid bone indicating bone loss

name: shallow glenoid fossa
description: Reduced depth of the glenoid cavity in the scapula

description: Distal phalanges of the hand that are shorter and broader than normal

name: short broad distal phalanx of thumb
description: Shortened and wider distal phalanx of the thumb

description: Fibula that is shorter in length than normal

description: Shortened length of the first metacarpal bone in the hand

description: Shortened length of the first metatarsal bone in the foot

name: short foot
description: Foot that is shorter than the normal length

name: short fourth metacarpal
description: Shortened length of the fourth metacarpal bone in the hand

name: short hand
description: Hand that is shorter than the normal length

description: Metacarpal bone in the hand that is shorter than normal length

name: short metatarsal
description: Metatarsal bone in the foot that is shorter than normal length

name: short metatarsals
description: Multiple metatarsal bones in the foot that are shorter than normal

name: short middle phalanges
description: Middle phalanges of the hand that are shorter than normal

name: short proximal phalanx
description: Proximal phalanx that is shorter than normally expected

name: short rib lesion
description: Lesion associated with a shortened rib

name: short ribs
description: Ribs that are shorter than the normal length

name: short squat bones
description: Bones that are both short in length and broad in shape

description: Distal phalanx of the thumb that is both short and thin

name: short thumb
description: Thumb that is shorter in length than expected

name: shortened bone with premature growth-plate closure
description: Bone has stopped growing early due to premature closure of the growth plate, leading to short stature or limb discrepancies.

name: single maxillary central incisor
description: Presence of one central incisor in the maxillary dental arch instead of two.

name: skull asymmetry
description: Uneven shape or size of the skull, which may be due to developmental issues or trauma.

name: skull base hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the skull base, which may affect surrounding structures.

name: slender clavicle
description: Clavicle appears thinner than normal, potentially due to genetic conditions or nutritional issues.

name: slender tubular long bones
description: The long bones of the limbs appear abnormally thin.

name: slipped capital femoral epiphysis
description: Displacement of the femoral head due to slippage at the growth plate, common in adolescents.

name: small acetabular angle
description: The angle of the acetabulum is smaller than normal, possibly indicating hip dysplasia.

name: small anterior fontanelle
description: A smaller than average space at the anterior fontanelle, sometimes due to early suture closure.

name: small epiphysis
description: The ends of the long bones appear smaller than expected, affecting growth.

name: small intervertebral foramen
description: A reduction in the size of the openings where spinal nerves exit.

name: small or dysplastic carpal and/or tarsal bones
description: Abnormal size or shape of the wrist or ankle bones due to developmental issues.

name: small sacroiliac notches
description: Sacroiliac notches appear reduced in size, potentially affecting joint function.

name: small sciatic notch
description: The sciatic notch is smaller than normal, which can be an anatomical variant.

name: soft-tissue calcification
description: Calcium deposits within soft tissues, which can be due to various pathological processes.

name: soft-tissue gas
description: Presence of gas within soft tissues, often indicative of infection or trauma.

name: soft-tissue mass with adjacent bone erosion
description: A mass in soft tissue that is causing erosion of the nearby bone, suggesting an aggressive process.

name: soft-tissue ossification
description: Formation of bone tissue within soft tissue, potential following injury or inflammation.

name: soft-tissue tumor in a child
description: Presence of a tumor in the soft tissues, requiring evaluation to determine benign or malignant status.

name: soft-tissue tumor in a young adult
description: Soft-tissue mass in a young adult, which can vary from benign to malignant and requires thorough investigation.

name: soft-tissue tumor in an older adult
description: A soft-tissue mass found in patients of older age.

name: soft-tissue tumor with associated calcification
description: A soft-tissue mass that contains calcified areas.

name: soft-tissue tumor with fluid-fluid level
description: A soft-tissue mass showing fluid-fluid levels, often in cystic or hemorrhagic areas.

name: soft-tissue tumor with prominent vascularity
description: A soft-tissue mass with increased blood supply, often detected by enhanced imaging.

name: solitary bone lesion with expansile remodeling
description: A single bone lesion characterized by expansile growth.

name: solitary collapsed vertebra
description: A single vertebra that has lost its structural integrity and collapsed.

name: solitary ill-defined lytic metaphyseal lesion
description: A poorly defined lytic lesion located at the metaphysis of a bone.

name: solitary large calcified soft tissue mass adjacent to bone
description: A large soft tissue mass with calcification, located adjacent to a bone.

name: solitary lytic diaphyseal bone lesion
description: A single lytic lesion located in the shaft (diaphysis) of a bone.

name: solitary lytic epiphyseal lesion
description: A lytic lesion located in the epiphysis of a bone.

name: solitary lytic epiphyseal-metaphyseal lesion
description: A bone lesion extending from the epiphysis to the metaphysis.

name: solitary osteolytic skull lesion
description: A single bone lesion in the skull characterized by bone loss.

name: solitary osteosclerotic bone lesion
description: A single bone lesion characterized by increased bone density.

name: solitary permeative metaphyseal lesion
description: A bone lesion with a permeative pattern seen in the metaphysis.

name: solitary poorly demarcated osteolytic bone lesion
description: A single bone lesion with indistinct borders and bone loss.

name: solitary well-defined lytic metaphyseal lesion
description: A distinct lytic lesion located in the metaphyseal region of a bone.

name: solitary well-demarcated lytic bone lesion
description: A clearly defined lytic lesion in a bone.

name: spiculated periosteal reaction
description: A pattern of periosteal reaction with spiculated (sunburst) appearance suggesting active bone formation.

name: spina bifida aperta
description: An open form of spina bifida where neural elements are exposed.

name: spina bifida occulta
description: A hidden form of spina bifida where the defect is covered by skin.

name: spinal block
description: An anesthetic or nerve block performed on the spinal cord to induce loss of sensation.

name: spinal osteopenia
description: Reduced bone mineral density in the spine indicating early stages of osteoporosis.

name: split cortex
description: Appearance of separated or divided cortical bone seen on imaging, often due to disease or injury.

name: spool-shaped vertebrae
description: Vertebrae that have a central constriction and widened ends resembling a spool, often due to skeletal dysplasias.

name: squaring of vertebral body
description: Loss of normal concavity of the anterior vertebral margin, making the vertebra appear more square.

name: stippled epiphyses
description: Punctate calcifications in the epiphyseal regions of growing bones, indicative of certain skeletal dysplasias.

name: straight fetal spine
description: Absence of normal curvature in the fetal spine, may indicate neural tube or other developmental defects.

name: subcutaneous tumor
description: A palpable or visible mass under the skin, often requiring imaging for further evaluation.

name: subperiosteal bone resorption
description: Erosion of the bone immediately beneath the periosteum, often associated with hyperparathyroidism.

name: supernumerary rib
description: Additional rib beyond the normal number, can be cervical or lumbar, potentially causing clinical issues.

name: symmetrical anterior rib flaring
description: Outward flaring of the anterior ribs, usually visible as part of certain dysplasias or overgrowth syndromes.

name: symmetrical sacroiliac joint abnormality
description: Bilateral changes in sacroiliac joints often associated with inflammatory or degenerative diseases such as ankylosing spondylitis.

name: symmetrical sacroiliac joint disease
description: Bilateral sacroiliitis, often a sign of spondyloarthropathies like ankylosing spondylitis.

name: symphalangism
description: Fusion of finger or toe joints resulting in limited movement, often due to genetic conditions.

name: syndactyly
description: Fusion or webbing of digits, most commonly fingers or toes, often congenital in origin.

name: synostosis of tubular bones
description: Fusion of long bones, potentially leading to functional impairment, often seen in congenital syndromes.

name: T1-hyperintense diffuse vertebral body abnormality
description: Increased T1 signal across vertebrae, can be associated with red marrow proliferation or other processes.

name: T1-hypointense diffuse vertebral body abnormality
description: Decreased T1 signal across vertebrae, indicative of conditions like edema or infiltration.

name: T2-hyperintense supraspinatus tendon
description: Increased T2 signal in the supraspinatus tendon, suggestive of tendinopathy or tear.

name: T2-hypointense intra-articular knee mass
description: Reduced T2 signal in a knee mass, often indicating fibrous/dense tissue content or prior hemorrhage.

name: T2-hypointense musculoskeletal lesion
description: A musculoskeletal lesion appearing darker on T2-weighted MRI images.

name: tail
description: Extension or elongated projection of a structure. Rarely used in radiology without specific context.

name: tall vertebrae
description: Vertebral bodies that appear elongated in height compared to typical dimensions.

name: tam-o-shanter skull
description: Thickened skull with appearance similar to a Scottish beret.

name: tarsal fusion
description: Congenital or acquired fusion of tarsal bones in the foot.

name: temporal bone neoplasm
description: Tumor originating from the temporal bone.

name: thick clavicle
description: Clavicle that appears increased in width or density.

name: thick heel pad
description: Increased thickness of the heel's soft tissue pad.

name: thick periosteal reaction along bone shaft
description: Periosteal new bone formation along the shaft of a bone.

name: thick ribs
description: Ribs that appear increased in density or width.

name: thick skull
description: Increased thickness of the cranial bones.

name: thick tubular hand bones
description: Hand bones that present with increased cortical thickness.

name: thin and small distal phalanges of the hand
description: The distal phalanges in the hand that are reduced in size and thinner than normal.

name: thin clavicle
description: Clavicle that appears decreased in width or density.

name: thin epiphyses
description: Epiphyses of bones that appear less dense and thinner than typical.

name: thin ribs
description: Ribs that appear reduced in density or width.

name: thirteen pairs of ribs
description: An anatomical variant where an individual has an extra pair of ribs.

name: thoracic dysplasia
description: Abnormal development of the thoracic cage resulting in structural abnormalities.

name: thoracolumbar gibbus
description: Angular kyphosis at the thoracolumbar junction.

name: tibial hypoplasia
description: Underdeveloped tibia, resulting in a reduced size of the bone.

name: tibiotalar tilt
description: Angle change between talus and tibia, usually indicating instability or injury.

name: transient arthritis
description: Temporary joint inflammation, often self-limiting.

name: transverse dense metaphyseal bands
description: Horizontal lines of increased density in metaphysis, often due to systemic conditions.

name: trident pelvis
description: A pelvis shape resembling a trident, often associated with skeletal dysplasias.

name: triphalangeal thumb
description: Thumb with three phalanges instead of two, often part of congenital syndromes.

name: tubular bone synostosis
description: Fusion between tubular bones, potentially causing deformities or limited movement.

name: tumor crossing an intervertebral disk
description: Mass lesion extending across a disc space, suggesting aggressive behavior.

name: tumor-induced osteomalacia
description: Bone softening due to phosphaturia caused by tumor-secreted substances.

name: tumor-like bone destruction with little periosteal reaction
description: Bone destruction mimicking a tumor without significant periosteal response.

name: tumor-like bone surface lesion
description: Lesion on bone surface resembling a tumor, often benign.

name: twisted bones
description: Abnormal torsion of bones, may be congenital or acquired.

name: type A pelvis
description: A specific pelvic shape classification based on anatomical structure.

name: type B pelvis
description: Another pelvic shape classification within pelvic anatomy variants.

name: ulnar ray hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of structures along the line of the ulna, possibly syndromic.

name: ulnar ray syndrome
description: Congenital anomaly affecting bones along the ulnar ray, often with other defects.

name: undersegmentation of sternum
description: Incomplete segmentation of sternal bones, possibly congenital

name: unilateral sacroiliac joint abnormality
description: Anomaly affecting one sacroiliac joint.

name: unilateral sacroiliac joint disease
description: Pathological condition affecting one sacroiliac joint, often inflammatory or degenerative.

name: unilateral small cranium
description: Asymmetric cranium size, typically due to developmental issues.

name: vacuum disk phenomenon
description: Gas presence within intervertebral disc space, often a sign of degeneration.

name: vascular calcification
description: Deposit of calcium in the vascular structures.

name: vascular deossification
description: Loss of calcium from vascular structures.

name: vertebral anomaly
description: Developmental variation of the vertebrae.

name: vertebral coronal cleft
description: Split or cleft in the vertebral body seen on coronal imaging.

name: vertebral malsegmentation
description: Abnormal segmentation or fusion of vertebrae.

name: vertebral neoplasm
description: Neoplastic growth affecting a vertebra.

name: vertebral pedicle destruction
description: Loss of structure within the vertebral pedicle, often due to malignancy or infection.

name: vertebral pedicle sclerosis
description: Increased density of the vertebral pedicle, indicating sclerosis.

name: vertical talus
description: Congenital deformity of the talus bone resulting in rigid flatfoot.

name: vertical trabeculation of vertebral body
description: Vertical alignment of trabeculae within the vertebral body.

name: wavy ribs
description: Wavy appearance of the ribs, often indicating underlying skeletal dysplasia.

name: wedged vertebra
description: Vertebra with wedged shape, commonly due to fracture or bone disease.

name: well-defined infectious bone lesion
description: Bone lesion with clear boundaries indicating infection.

name: wide diametaphysis
description: Increased width of the diametaphysis in long bones.

name: wide intervertebral disk space
description: Increased space between vertebrae at the disk location.

name: wide metaphyses
description: Broadening of the metaphyses, often associated with bone disorders.

name: wide metaphysis
description: Broadened single metaphysis, can indicate a growth disorder.

name: wide pubic symphysis
description: Increased distance between pubic bones at the symphysis.

name: wide ribs
description: Increased thickness of the ribs.

name: wide spinal canal
description: Increased width of the spinal canal, potentially due to anatomical variation or pathologies.

name: wide sutures
description: Abnormal widening of cranial sutures in infants or children.

name: wide thumb
description: An abnormally broad or thick thumb often associated with genetic conditions.

name: widened joint space
description: Increased space between articulating bones in a joint, possible sign of effusion or abnormal growth.

name: widespread areas of bone destruction
description: Multiple regions of bone loss or decay throughout the skeleton.

name: widespread cortical bone thickening
description: Diffuse increase in the thickness of the cortical layer of bones.

name: widespread cortical bone thinning
description: General reduction in the thickness of the cortical layer of bones.

name: widespread demineralization with coarse trabeculation
description: Loss of mineral density in bones with prominent trabeculae.

name: widespread osteosclerosis
description: Diffuse increase in bone density across multiple bones.

name: widespread osteosclerosis of medullary and cortical bone
description: Generalized increase in density affecting both the medullary and cortical regions of bones.

name: widespread periosteal reaction
description: Diffuse new bone formation on the periosteal surface observed radiographically.

name: widespread predominantly cortical osteosclerosis
description: Increased bone density primarily affecting the cortical region of bones.

name: widespread predominantly medullary osteosclerosis
description: Increased bone density primarily affecting the medullary region of bones.

name: widespread soft-tissue calcification
description: Diffuse deposition of calcium salts in soft tissues.

name: Wormian bones
description: Accessory bones within the sutures of the skull, often associated with congenital disorders.

name: xanthomatous bone lesion
description: Bone lesion characterized by lipid-laden macrophages.
